result.execSummary:
The defendant Gonzalo Anguiano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge and pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.    Non-payment penalty shall be civil judgment.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
As a convicted felon, and a DV conviction, defendant may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor. 
Defendant may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

NO DIRECT CONTACT with Maria G.  
Court allows for communication through mail and phone.  
Court allows contact with his mothers.  
NO new law violations rising to the level of Probabale Cause.

charges.descr: Endanger Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon

records.addlTxt:
Order on Petition for Determination of Eligibility for the Substance Abuse Program, signed and filed. tk 
The Court orders: The petition is denied.   The defendant's is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program because the 
-seriousness of the crime requires continued confinement. 
-defendant's character suggests the defendant's character suggests the defendant would not be successful in this program.
-defendant needs to be confined to protect the community. 

Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for eligibility for the Substance Abuse Program.
Original Transcript (21 pages) commencing 12-21-2015 SENTENCING received and filed.
Request for payment of $51  witness fees for witness Sandy D.  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26190802 in court 3x on 6/8/15, 9/8/15, 11/23/15.
Request for payment of $51  witness fees for witness Maria D. C. R processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26190801 in court 3x on 6/8/15, 9/8/15, 11/23/15.
Associated with Charge #3

Defendant Gonzalo Anguiano in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Gonzalo Anguiano in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statement by Maria G.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 332 days time served.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-No direct contact with 
Maria G.  Court allows for communication through mail and telephone
-Court allows contact with his mothers

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, and a DV conviction, he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Fiiled, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet
Reinstating the defendant's phone privileges. Signed and filed.

Case recalled. Defendant present in court in custody with Counsel John Krejci. Nicholas Heitman appeared for the State. 
AS TO COUNTS 1,2,4,5,6:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered. Case adjourned in branch 38.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties state they are ready to proceed to trial. Case passed.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Jury trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Gonzalo Anguiano in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Defendant Gonzalo Anguiano in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Denny Motion Withdrawn by Defense Counsel. Defendant Gonzalo Anguiano in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Defendant Gonzalo Anguiano in custody.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Marco Lopez.  Exhibit 1 marked for identification.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  All available discovery, offer letter and discovery demand turned was turned over to defense counsel by the State.  

For the reasons as stated on the record, State's Motion to Rescind Defendant's Telephone and U.S. Mail Privileges is heard and granted by the Court.  The State to prepare a proposed order for the Court.  

All conditions of bail, including no contact with Maria R. by phone or any means, no contact with Luz V. or Nelinda R.., no weapons or violations of the law.  

Case adjourned for Defense Bail / Bond Motion in Branch 4 on 3-2-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Based on the medical emergency of defense counsel, Court extended the time limits and ordered Preliminary Hearing adjourned to Branch 4 on 2-10-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
